arts.ttl: Sheffield United 1-4 Bristol City: Twine shines with brace and assist as Robins stun Blades in season opener
arts.sum: In between those goals, the Blades scored as Tyrese Campbell opened his account for the season, but their chances of earning anything from this clash slowly faded as Asin Mehmeti and Twine added a third and fourth respectively to drown United in their sorrows. Scott Twine scored twice and earned an assist in an excellent individual showing to help Bristol City beat last season’s play-off finalists Sheffield United at Bramall Lane.

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: four-star Bristol City stun Sheffield United
arts.sum: Late Langstaff strike gives Millwall victory at Norwich Charlton, West Brom and Portsmouth secure wins Rubén Sellés’ tenure as Sheffield United manager got off to a nightmare start after a 4-1 home defeat by Bristol City. The Spaniard was thrust into the Bramall Lane hotseat following the surprise sacking of Chris Wilder after the Blades’ playoff final defeat, but his stint could not have begun any worse. Scott Twine’s double and goals from Ross McCrorie and Anis Mehmeti ensured Gerard Struber’s first game in charge of the Robins was much more enjoyable. Tyrese Campbell had levelled for Sheffield United but this performance will raise big questions about their promotion credentials. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Twine stars as scintillating Bristol City thump Sheffield United
arts.sum: Sheffield United boss Ruben Selles endured a miserable start to life at Bramall Lane as they began the season with a 4-1 thumping at the hands of Bristol City.
